meanings.definition: Make the sound and movement of vomiting.
meanings.sent1: The sick child retches after eating too much candy.
meanings.sent2: She retches uncontrollably after smelling the spoiled milk.
meanings.sent3: The dog retches comically after trying to eat a whole watermelon.
meanings.sent4: The boat's engine retches loudly, spewing smoke into the air.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs makes her retches violently.

meanings.definition: A person who is vomiting or about to vomit.
meanings.sent1: The retches of the seasick passenger filled the air.
meanings.sent2: The poor child was one of the retches in the school play.
meanings.sent3: The retches in the waiting room made everyone feel queasy.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a retches as she stumbled out of the party.
meanings.sent5: The retches in the movie scene looked very realistic.
